decks.notes: The main focus of this Dragon Stompy deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's resources by utilizing powerful artifact cards like Blood Moon, Chalice of the Void, and The One Ring. By utilizing fast mana sources like Chrome Mox and City of Traitors, the deck aims to quickly play threats like Broadside Bombardiers and Fury to pressure the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Magus of the Moon and Sundering Eruption further enhances the deck's ability to disrupt the opponent's mana base and board state, ultimately leading to a fast and aggressive victory.

The deck focuses on using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage to control the game. It disrupts the opponent's strategy with cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will, while also generating card advantage with cards like Baleful Strix and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent with efficient threats like Barrowgoyf and Snapcaster Mage, while also maintaining a stable mana base with a mix of fetch lands and dual lands. Overall, the deck aims to control the pace of the game and grind out wins through attrition.

The deck aims to control the game by disrupting the opponent's spells and creatures with counterspells like Force of Will and removal spells like Swords to Plowshares. It also includes hand disruption like Thoughtseize to further disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck uses card draw and filtering like Brainstorm and Ponder to find the right answers at the right time. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and helps with card selection. The deck also includes threats like Murktide Regent and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares to pressure the opponent while controlling the game.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly pressure the opponent with aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Dragon's Rage Channeler, and Murktide Regent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Force of Will and Daze. The deck aims to control the board with counterspells and removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat, while also utilizing card selection and manipulation with cards like Ponder and Brainstorm. Wasteland is included to disrupt the opponent's mana base, giving the UR Aggro deck a tempo advantage and putting pressure on the opponent to react quickly.

This deck focuses on controlling the pace of the game while applying pressure with low-cost, efficient creatures and disruption spells. By utilizing cheap removal spells and counterspells, combined with powerful tempo plays such as bounce effects and hand disruption, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure on the board. The creatures in the deck provide additional ways to disrupt the opponent's strategy and close out the game quickly. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive tempo strategy while also providing consistency in casting spells.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping out powerful threats like Emrakul using cards like Show and Tell and Omniscience, while also controlling the game with counterspells like Force of Will. The deck also utilizes cards like Cunning Wish to access sideboard options, Veil of Summer to protect key combo pieces, and Stock Up to find needed cards. Atraxa, Grand Unifier and LÃ³rien Revealed provide additional utility and protection. The key strategy is to combo off early and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats before they can establish their own game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with key combo pieces and then win the game by casting a spell that will either cause the opponent to lose the game or deck out. The deck utilizes various fast mana sources and cards that enable milling of one's own library to achieve this goal, while also including protection in the form of counterspells and disruptive spells. The key strategy is to assemble the necessary pieces as quickly as possible and execute the combo before the opponent can stop it.

The main concept of this deck revolves around quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, then using spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring them back onto the battlefield. The deck also includes various ways to disrupt the opponent's hand and game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Cabal Therapy. By efficiently reanimating threats and disrupting the opponent, this deck aims to win the game through a powerful combo strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to use cards like Show and Tell, Omniscience, and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn to cheat powerful creatures onto the battlefield quickly. The deck also includes control elements like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo. With cards like Ponder, Brainstorm, and Stock Up providing card selection and draw power, the goal is to set up the combo as quickly as possible while disrupting the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and win the game before they can respond effectively.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize powerful creatures and spells to control the board and generate mana quickly through Gaea's Cradle. By using various creatures like Allosaurus Shepherd and Fiend Artisan alongside spells like Natural Order and Green Sun's Zenith, the deck aims to outvalue and outpace the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Crop Rotation and Collector Ouphe provide additional utility and disruption to ensure the control aspect of the strategy is maintained. Overall, the deck aims to establish dominance through efficient mana generation and powerful creature interactions.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. It relies on powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Time Raveler to maintain board control and outvalue opponents. The deck also features a mix of versatile removal options like Swords to Plowshares and Prismatic Ending. Additionally, it includes strong card selection tools like Brainstorm and Ponder to find key cards quickly. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt opponents' game plans while generating card advantage to ultimately secure a victory.

This deck aims to aggressively establish board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan early on, leveraging fast mana sources to quickly deploy threats. By reducing the opponent's ability to cast spells efficiently with cards like Chancellor of the Annex and Archon of Emeria, the deck can maintain control of the game while applying pressure with creatures like Broadside Bombardiers. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Wasteland to further hinder the opponent's mana development. Overall, this deck is designed to quickly take control of the game and maintain dominance through aggressive plays.

The deck focuses on utilizing control elements such as counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to establish a dominating position on the board. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while gradually building up card advantage and controlling the pace of the game. The key strategy is to effectively manage resources, protect key threats like Murktide Regent and Thundertrap Trainer, and eventually outvalue the opponent to secure a victory. Additionally, the deck includes utility lands and a diverse mix of spells to adapt to various matchups and situations, maintaining a flexible and strategic approach to gameplay.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive abilities. The deck aims to stifle the opponent's strategies while maintaining board presence with threats like Phyrexian Dreadnought and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. By using cards like Dress Down and Swords to Plowshares, the deck can handle a variety of threats while also drawing cards and manipulating the top of the library with Brainstorm and Ponder. Overall, the deck focuses on controlling the game and outmaneuvering the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to use artifact cards and aggressive creatures to quickly pressure the opponent. By utilizing cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Mishra's Bauble, the deck aims to generate card advantage and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Urza's Saga and Mox Opal provide additional mana acceleration and synergy with artifacts. The deck also includes disruption spells like Force of Will and Pithing Needle to control the board. Overall, the deck focuses on a fast-paced, artifact-based strategy to outpace and overwhelm the opponent.

This Grixis Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through various forms of removal and hand disruption, while also utilizing card draw and selection to ensure the pilot has the right answers at the right time. The deck aims to control the board using powerful threats like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Murktide Regent, while also leveraging versatile spells like Force of Will and Kolaghan's Command to maintain dominance. With a mix of removal, counterspells, and threats, this deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver its opponents in a grindy and attrition-based matchup.
